DOC.brief_summary: To define evaluate impact angiographic coregistered OCT physician decision-making prospective data collection PCI procedure .
DOC.brief_title: Observational Study Angiographic Coregistered Optical Coherence Tomography Patients Undergoing PCI
DOC.criteria: Age ≥ 18 year . Patient provide sign write informed consent studyspecific procedure . Patients suffer coronary artery disease ( CAD ) include least one angiographically significant ( > 70 % visual estimation ) stenosis present native coronary artery plan PCI . Subjects emergent PCI cardiogenic shock . Subjects target leave main ( LM ) lesion , restenosis stent thrombosis target vessel aortoostial lesion location within 3 mm aorta junction ( right left ) . Extreme angulation ( > 90° ) excessive tortuosity ( > two 45° angle ) proximal within target lesion . Known renal insufficiency ( example limit estimate glomerular Filtration rate ( eGFR ) < 50 ml/kg/m2 , serum creatinine ≥ 2.5 mg/dL dialysis ) . Any medical condition opinion investigator interfere patient safety study result . Currently participate another clinical study interferes study result . Pregnant nursing subject plan pregnancy period 1 year follow index procedure . Any condition precludes subject undergoing PCI , example subject heparin induce thrombocytopenia , contrast allergy
